body_html:
I found the answer ：
Define the Saver in Your computing Graph （before the Session.run）
like this

saver = tf.train.Saver() 
init = tf.initialize_all_variables() 
with tf.Session() as session: with tf.device("/cpu:1"):
			while iter < max_iter:
				loss_np, _, label_np, image_np, inf_np = session.run([loss, opti, batch_image, batch_label, inf])
				#print image_np.shape
				#print label_np.shape
				#cv2.imshow(str(label_np[0]),image_np[0])  
				#print label_np[0]  
				#cv2.waitKey()  
				#print label_np
				if iter % 50 == 0:
					print 'trainloss:', loss_np
				if iter % 1000== 0:
					saver.save(session, os.path.join('model','model.ckpt'))

body:
I found the answer ：
**Define the Saver in Your computing Graph （before the Session.run）**
like this 
```
saver = tf.train.Saver() 
init = tf.initialize_all_variables() 
with tf.Session() as session: with tf.device("/cpu:1"):
			while iter < max_iter:
				loss_np, _, label_np, image_np, inf_np = session.run([loss, opti, batch_image, batch_label, inf])
				#print image_np.shape
				#print label_np.shape
				#cv2.imshow(str(label_np[0]),image_np[0])  
				#print label_np[0]  
				#cv2.waitKey()  
				#print label_np
				if iter % 50 == 0:
					print 'trainloss:', loss_np
				if iter % 1000== 0:
					saver.save(session, os.path.join('model','model.ckpt'))
```
